subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: José Tábata, a Pittsburgh Pirates prospect, was not involved in any wrongdoing in a bizarre case in which his wife was charged with abducting a 2-month-old girl from a Florida couple, the police told the club. Tábata, a 20-year-old outfielder who was acquired from the Yankees in the Xavier Nady trade, said in a statement that he was “hurt, frustrated, and confused” that his wife, Amalia Tábata Pereira, 43, was accused of taking the girl from a woman at a health clinic in Plant City, east of Tampa, on Monday night.
